model_solution:
Step 1: Apply the sum-to-product identities to the expression \[\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ.\]
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 90^\circ \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]
Step 2: Simplify the expression to \[\frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 90^\circ \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{2 \left( \frac{1}{2} \right) \cos 17^\circ + 2 (1) \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]
Step 3: Simplify the expression to \[\frac{2 \left( \frac{1}{2} \right) \cos 17^\circ + 2 (1) \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\cos 17^\circ + 2 \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]
Step 4: Simplify the expression to 
\[\frac{\cos 17^\circ + 2 \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\cos 17^\circ + \cos 73^\circ + \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]
Step 5: Apply the sum-to-product identity to the expression $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ$, $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ = 2 \cos 45^\circ \sin 38^\circ = 2 \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\right) \sin 38^\circ = \sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ$.
Final Answer: $\frac{3 \cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ + \cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} + \frac{\cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} + 1.$
steps:
Step 1: Apply the sum-to-product identities to the expression \[\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ.\]
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 90^\circ \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]

Step 5: Apply the sum-to-product identity to the expression $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ$, $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ = 2 \cos 45^\circ \sin 38^\circ = 2 \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\right) \sin 38^\circ = \sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ$.
full_steps:
Step 1: Apply the sum-to-product identities to the expression \[\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ.\]
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 90^\circ \cos 73^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\]

Step 5: Apply the sum-to-product identity to the expression $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ$, $\cos 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ = 2 \cos 45^\circ \sin 38^\circ = 2 \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\right) \sin 38^\circ = \sqrt{2} \sin 38^\circ$.
